title: Islamabad Police to ensure foolproof security arrangements at High Security Zone
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 29 (APP):Responding to the special directions of Inspector General of Police (IGP) Islamabad Syed Ali Nasir Rizvi, the Islamabad Police is using all available resources to ensure the peace and tranquility within the federal capital.
A police public relations officer on Monday said that the Islamabad Police ensure data registration, identification documents and effective search of citizens entering the high security zone on a regular basis.
During the last week, the capital police removed tinted glass papers from 869 vehicles, and improper number plates from 142 vehicles. Moreover, legal action against 312 vehicles without documents was also taken.
He further said that strict directions have been issued to police officers and officials performing their duties at high security zone checkpoints to exercise their duty with full responsibility.
The protection of important public and private property and embassies located in the high security zone is of paramount importance.
The police officers were further directed to ensure the data entry of all citizens entering the high security zone, the identification documents should be thoroughly scrutinized, all suspicious vehicles should be searched and a positive attitude has been taken towards the public.
The citizens are also urged to cooperate with the Islamabad Capital Police and to report any suspicious activity on emergency helpline “Pucar-15” or at ICT-15 app.
